Package com.quality_air.quality_air_backend.controller

Class UserController

java.lang.Object
com.quality_air.quality_air_backend.controller.UserController
@RestController @RequestMapping("/user") public class UserController extends Object
Controller class for managing User entities. This class provides RESTful API endpoints to perform CRUD operations on User entities, including creating, updating, retrieving, and logging in users.

  • Method Details

    • getAll

      @CrossOrigin(origins="*") @GetMapping public List<User> getAll()
      Retrieves a list of all active users in the database.
      Returns:
      a list of active users.

    • insert

      @CrossOrigin(origins="*") @PostMapping public User insert(@RequestBody User enter)
      Creates a new user in the database.
      Parameters:
      enter - the User entity to be created.
      Returns:
      the created User entity.

    • update

      @CrossOrigin(origins="*") @PutMapping(path="/{id}") public User update(@RequestBody User enter, @PathVariable("id") int id)
      Updates an existing user in the database.
      Parameters:
      enter - the User entity with updated data.
      id - the ID of the user to be updated.
      Returns:
      the updated User entity.

    • getId

      @CrossOrigin(origins="*") @GetMapping(path="/{id}") public Optional<User> getId(@PathVariable("id") int id)
      Retrieves a specific user based on their ID.
      Parameters:
      id - the ID of the user to retrieve.
      Returns:
      an Optional containing the user if found, otherwise empty.

    • authenticate

      @CrossOrigin(origins="*") @PostMapping("/login") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Map<String,String>> authenticate(@RequestParam("identifier") String identifier, @RequestParam("password") String password)
      Authenticates a user using their email or nickname and password.
      Parameters:
      identifier - the email or nickname of the user.
      password - the password of the user.
      Returns:
      a ResponseEntity containing the authentication status.
